info.title: MGnify API
info.description:
**The API for [MGnify](https://www.ebi.ac.uk/metagenomics), EBI’s platform for the submission, analysis, discovery and comparison of metagenomic-derived datasets.**

## Endpoints
API endpoints (URLs) are available for all data types stored in MGnify.
In general, there are list endpoints (ending `/`) and detail endpoints (ending `/<accession>`) for individually accessioned data.
Where a data type is not accessioned, alternative natural identifiers are used (like a short `slug` for Super Studies).
Commonly used relationships are available as nested list endpoints, like `studies/{accession}/samples` for the samples belonging to a study.

## Data format
The API returns JSON responses.
List endpoints return data in the format `{count: 10, items: [{...}, ...]}` (unless specified otherwise).
Detail endpoints return a single object `{...}`.

## Data availability
Most data are public, available without authentication.
Private data is available only to authenticated users, and the authentication is based on Webin credentials from ENA.
To use these, a JWT token must be obtained for the Webin credentials, using the `/auth` endpoints.

get.summary: Get MGnify analysis by accession

GetStudyForAnalysis.description: The study_accession is an identifier that can be used to access the Study detail

get.description: MGnify analyses are accessioned with an MYGA-prefixed identifier and correspond to an individual Run or Assembly analysed by a Pipeline.

get.summary: List all analyses (MGYAs) available from MGnify
get.description: Each analysis is the result of a Pipeline execution on a reads dataset (either a raw read-run, or an assembly).

get.summary: Get MGnify analysis by accession, with annotations and downloadable files
get.description: MGnify analyses have annotations (taxonomic and functional assignments), and downloadable files (outputs from the pipeline execution).

get.summary: Get a named set of annotations for a MGnify analysis by accession.
get.description: List the annotations of a given type for a MGnify analysis referred to by its accession.

get.summary: Get the detail of a single publication
get.description: Get detailed information about a publication, including associated studies.

get.summary: Get any full-text annotations associated with the publication
get.description: Full-text annotations are retrieved from Europe PMC, text mined for relevant metagenomic metadata terms

get.summary: List all publications
get.description: List all publications in the MGnify database.

get.summary: Get the detail of a single sample analysed by MGnify

GetStudyFromSampleStudiesList.description: The accession is an identifier that can be used to access the Study detail

get.description: MGnify samples inherit directly from samples (or BioSamples) in ENA.

get.description: List all publications associated with this study.

get.summary: Get the detail of a single Super Study

GetStudyFromSuperStudyFlagshipStudiesLis.description: The accession is an identifier that can be used to access the Study detail

GetStudyFromSuperStudyRelatedStudiesList.description: The accession is an identifier that can be used to access the Study detail

GetGenomeCatalogueFromSuperStudyGenomeCa.description: The catalogue_id is an identifier that can be used to access the Genome Catalogue detail

get.description: A Super Study is a collection of MGnify Studies all related to a single large initiative. They may also reference Genome Catalogues that were assembled from the Studies or as part of the Super Study initiative.

get.summary: List all Super Studies

GetSuperStudyFromSuperStudyItemsList.description: The slug is an identifier that can be used to access the Super Study detail

get.description: Super Studies are collections of MGnify Studies associated with major initiatives.

get.summary: Get the detail of a single MGnify Genome

GetCatalogueForGenome.description: The catalogue_id is an identifier that can be used to access the Catalogue detail

get.description: MGnify Genomes are either isolates, or MAGs derived from binned metagenomes.

get.summary: Get the annotations for a single MGnify Genome
get.description: Annotations are taxonomic and functional assignments for the genome.

get.summary: List all genomes across MGnify Genome catalogues
get.description: MGnify Genomes are either isolates, or MAGs derived from binned metagenomes.

get.summary: List all genome catalogues
get.description: MGnify Genomes Catalogues are biome-specific collections of isolate and MAG genomes.

get.summary: Get genome catalogue by ID
Get genomes within the genome catalogue
List all assemblies available in MGnify
get.description: Each assembly represents a collection of contigs generated by assembling sequencing reads from an MGnify or run

get.summary: Get assembly by accession

GetStudyForAssembly.description: The reads_study_accession is an identifier that can be used to access the Study detail

GetStudyForAnalysis.description: The study_accession is an identifier that can be used to access the Study detail

GetAdditionalcontainedgenomesForAssembly.description: Additional contained genomes discovered for this assembly

get.description: Get detailed information about a specific assembly.

get.summary: List genome/MAG links for an assembly
get.description:
Return genome links (e.g. MAG associations) for a specific assembly.
Accessible at `/assemblies/{accession}/genome-links`.

get.summary: List additional contained genomes for an assembly
get.description:
Return additional contained genomes (and their metrics) discovered for this assembly.
Accessible at `/assemblies/{accession}/additional-contained-genomes`.

get.summary: List analyses for an assembly
get.description:
Return MGnify analyses (MGYAs) that were generated from this assembly.
Accessible at `/assemblies/{accession}/analyses`.

post.summary: Obtain an authentication token using Webin credentials.
post.description: Obtain an authentication JWT token using Webin credentials. This token is sliding, i.e. it can be used both to access private data endpoints and to refresh itself after expiry.

post.summary: Refresh an authentication token to increase its validity duration.
post.description: If a token's expiry has passed, but its (longer) refresh expiry remains valid, this endpoint can be used to fetch a replacement token without logging in again.

tags.name: Studies
tags.description:
MGnify studies are based on ENA studies/projects, and are collections of samples, runs, assemblies,
and analyses associated with a certain set of experiments.

tags.name: Samples
tags.description: MGnify samples are based on ENA/BioSamples samples, and represent individual biological samples.

tags.name: Analyses
tags.description:
MGnify analyses are runs of a standard pipeline on an individual sequencing run or assembly.
They can include collections of taxonomic and functional annotations.

tags.name: Publications
tags.description:
Publications (e.g. journal articles) may describe or analyse the content of MGnify Studies
or their corresponding datasets in ENA.

tags.name: Genomes
tags.description:
MGnify Genomes are annotated draft genomes based on either isolates, or metagenome-assembled genomes (MAGs).
They are arranged in biome-specific catalogues.

tags.name: Private Data
tags.description:
MGnify supports private data, inheriting ENA's data privacy model and public release times.
Authentication is required to view private data owned by a Webin account.

tags.name: Miscellaneous
tags.description: Other miscellaneous endpoints in support of the API.

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description:
A Token can be obtained using an ENA Webin username and password,
to access the Private Data endpoints.
